New Records: Daryl Mitchell scored his first World Cup half-century from 43 balls and later hit 39 off 24 balls to secure victory.
Trent Boult took his 200th ODI wicket during the match.
Mushfiqur Rahim scored his 57th ODI half-century.
Key Match Events: Daryl Mitchell hit a six to seal New Zealand's victory with over 8 wickets in hand.
Kane Williamson retired hurt after being hit on the thumb, which was a significant moment in the match.
Shakib Al Hasan and Mushfiqur Rahim formed a crucial 62-run stand, which was a turning point in the match.
Bangladesh's innings was disrupted by the loss of key players due to cramps and wicket dismissals.
Pre-Game Insights: New Zealand won the toss and decided to bowl, considering potential dew conditions.
Kane Williamson returned to the lineup after a long recovery from an ACL injury.
Bangladesh's experienced players Shakib Al Hasan and Mushfiqur Rahim were key to their batting lineup.
Post-Match Reflections: New Zealand players celebrated their comprehensive win, with Daryl Mitchell and Mitchell Santner highlighting the performance.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played on a good surface, but Bangladesh struggled against New Zealand's pace and spin.
Bangladesh's batting average against short-pitched bowling is a historical weakness, which was exploited by New Zealand.
Others: The match was live-streamed on ESPN+, and detailed ball-by-ball commentary was provided.
